Class Format¶

Format module that formats date/time/date-range/numbers/currency/percentage depending on the language.

Example:

var today = new Date();
var someInterval = formatterInstance.formatRange(today, new Date(today.getFullYear(),
                   today.getMonth()+1, today.getDate()), 'de_DE');
var decNumber = formatter(345989.3452, 'de_DE');

console.log(someInterval) // => 'Juli 10 - August 10. 2013'
console.log(decNumber) // => '345.989,3452'

Constructor¶

class Format()¶

Methods¶

formatCurrency¶

Format#formatCurrency(number, locale)¶
Arguments:
  • number (Number) – the number to be formatted in currency context
  • locale (String) – the language in which you want to format the currency
Returns String:

the formatted currency in the desired language

Formats a number and outputs in the country’s currency format standards. If not present falls to default language of the server and if that is also missing it uses a configuration preset format.

formatDate¶

Format#formatDate(date, locale[, format])¶
Arguments:
  • date (String) – the date that you want to format
  • locale (String) – the language in which you want to format the date
  • format (String) – optional parameter of the way to format the date
Returns String:

the formatted date in the desired language

Formats a date in the country’s date format standards. If not present falls to default language of the server and if that is also missing it uses a configuration preset format.

formatNumber¶

Format#formatNumber(value, locale)¶
Arguments:
  • value (Number) – the value that you want to format
  • locale (String) – the language in which you want to format the number
Returns String:

the formatted number in the desired language

Formats a given number taking into account the decimals and the thousands. If not present falls to default language of the server and if that is also missing it uses a configuration preset format.

formatPercentage¶

Format#formatPercentage(number, locale)¶
Arguments:
  • number (Number) – the number to be formatted in percentage context
  • locale (String) – the language in which you want to format the percentage
Returns String:

the formatted percentage in the desired language

Formats a number and ouputs it in the country’s percentage format standards. If not present falls to default language of the server and if that is also missing it uses a configuration preset format.

formatRange¶

Format#formatRange(startDate, endDate, locale)¶
Arguments:
  • startDate (String) – the start date of the range
  • endDate (String) – the end date of the range
  • locale (String) – the language in which you want to format
Returns String:

the formatted range in the desired language

Formats a date range in the default date range format of the country. If not present falls to default language of the server and if that is also missing it uses a configuration preset format.

formatTime¶

Format#formatTime(date, locale)¶
Arguments:
  • date (String) – the date for which you want the time format
  • locale (String) – the language in which you want to format the time
Returns String:

the formatted time in the desired language

Formats a time in the country’s time format standards. If not present falls to default language of the server and if that is also missing it uses a configuration preset format.

get¶

Format.get()¶
Returns Format:

Singleton method to get the instance of the Format module.

translate¶

Format#translate(customId, msgId, language, args)¶
Arguments:
  • customId (String) – the customId from the .po file
  • msgId (String) – the msgId representing the default text for that customId
  • language (String) – the language in which you want to translate
  • args ([String]) – the arguments to be inserted in the translation
Returns String:

the translated text.

Translates a text. Logs an error if the translation was not possible.
